newsitem.title: NIGER: Private radio station ransacked in Niger.
newsitem.headline: Private radio station ransacked in Niger.

text.p: Unidentified uniformed men ransacked Niger's Anfani independent radio station on Saturday, smashing equipment and forcing it off the air, witnesses said.
The radio station, set up in January 1995 and broadcasting on FM, has had frequent run-ins with the administration of President Ibrahim Bare Mainassara.
The authorities shut it down for several days on the first day of the disputed July presidential elections after it interviewed an opposition candidate.
Mainassara, a soldier who seized power in January 1996, won the elections. The opposition and United States cried fraud.
Two other private radio stations broadcast in Niger and have had no such problems.
